content: the back of the same stitch and slide both off the left needle together this increases your stitch count by one 3 needle bind off 3 needle bind-offs can be done with the right sides together or the wrong sides together depending on what you want to accomplish in this pattern you do it with the wrong sides together what you are basically doing is a k2tog only instead of the stitches being side by side like they normally are they are one in front of the other once you have completed 2 of these k2tog s you pull one over the other like a regular bind off do another k2tog and bind off again all the way across here is a breakdown of how to do it many excellent resources online 1 from your beginning of round marker push 1/2 of the stitches onto 1 needle and 1/2 the stitches onto the other one in the case of closing the fish body in this pattern this means you ll have 20 on the back needle 20 on the front 2 knit the 1st stitch from the front needle and the 1st stitch from the back stitch together this isn t hard just a little trickier than a regular k2tog go through the front needle stitch go through the back needle stitch wrap yarn to knit carefully pull yarn through the back needle stitch carefully pull yarn through the front needle stitch one completed repeat to create a 2nd k2togethered stitch 3 bind off 1 stitch by pulling the 2nd stitch over the first stitch just like a regular bind off this is typically the step i forget i get so caught up in doing nice front/back k2togethers that after i m about half way across i realize i didn t do the bind-offs if this happens don t panic just carefully undo each stitch putting the back needle stitch on the back needle and the front needle stitch on the front needle regroup work the front/back k2tog s again and this time bind off bor beginning of round picking up stitches there are several place where the pattern directs you to pick up stitches once after closing the body and starting to work the tail and again for the dorsal and pectoral fins for the tail you are directed to run a rescue row which will greatly help you in finding the stitches to pick up for the fins you just grab stitches from the work already done when you pick up a stitch the stitch is a little loop with 2 legs you want to grab one of those legs not both if you pick up a left leg pick up the left leg of each stitch going down the column again many good online sources i ll add a few directions in the pattern and there s a mini tutorial at the end * * repeat the directions between the asterisks over and over hat #43 fish
